text:
7.3. Multivariate MLP Models 69
Vector-Output MLP Model
We are now ready to ﬁt an MLP model on this data. As with the previous case of multivariate
input, we must ﬂatten the three dimensional structure of the input data samples to a two
dimensional structure of [samples, features], where lag observations are treated as features
by the model.
# flatten input
n_input = X.shape[1] * X.shape[2]
X = X.reshape((X.shape[0], n_input))
